intro: Nemcia stipularis, commonly known as the stipular nemcia, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. Its leaves are alternate and have prominent stipules, which are small, leaf-like structures at the base of the leaf stalk. Nemcia stipularis is often found in moist, tropical environments and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
